definition: to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: When his headaches developed Nick became bad- tempered and even violent.
sentences.chinese: 尼克出現頭痛時脾氣就變得很差，甚至還會動粗。

sentences.english: A twelve-year-old girl would go to war for Rometra.
sentences.chinese: 一個12歲的女孩曾對Rometra動粗。

sentences.english: She studied me warily, as if I might turn violent.
sentences.chinese: 她警惕地看着我，似乎擔心我會動粗。

sentences.english: They want you to shake the shit out of them till you hear the cops coming.
sentences.chinese: 她想逼你動粗，一直到警察來爲止。

sentences.english: Teacher to manage children with poor management on the use of brute force, people are really very teeth.
sentences.chinese: 老師管理孩子管理不好就動粗，真的是讓人很不齒的。

sentences.english: Etc. , the somebody didn't resort to violence, opposed, directly carry breakfast to go to bed.
sentences.chinese: 等了等，某人竟然沒動粗，相反，直接把早點端上牀。

definition: to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
man behind the mirror/puppet master/string puller
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
public courtroom accusation (idiom)/legal confrontation/to take sb to court/to sue
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
to fight back/to return fire/to counterattack
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
